Post.title: Decorator
Post.content:
Decorator is useful when using others code.

Especially when you wanna add some function, say logging, to it.

To illustrate, we need a sample function first.

What if we wanna add logging function so that it can tell us the date when it excuate?

Basically, it means using another function, in order to add new funtion, to call target function.

Its likelog(func) -> wrapper() -> func()

We can also custom log from outside.

Why not be simpler?

Put @funcB above funcA means funcA = funcB(funcA)

Lets make it general log!
Post.more:
Decorator is useful when using others code.

Especially when you wanna add some function, say logging, to it.

To illustrate, we need a sample function first.

What if we wanna add logging function so that it can tell us the date when it excuate?

Basically, it means using another function, in order to add new funtion, to call target function.

Its likelog(func) -> wrapper() -> func()

We can also custom log from outside.

Why not be simpler?

Put @funcB above funcA means funcA = funcB(funcA)

Lets make it general log!

Post.title: python
Post._content:
***

# Miss Python
![Mrs python](https://static.mengniang.org/common/c/c0/Python.jpg)

Hackintosh macos  Miss Python 

 blog  mac 

## map/reduce

### map(fx,List[xx,yy,zz]):  f List
 map Iterable str

 ```
def check_name(str):
	return str[0].upper() + str[1::].lower()

L1 = ['tom','WINA','stARr']
print( list ( map ( check_name, L1 ) ) )
#result: ['Tom', 'Wina', 'Starr']
 ```
 
### reduce(fx, List[a,b,c,d]) = f( f( f(a, b), c), d) fx ,
```
from functools import reduce # import
def product(List):
	def _multiple(x,y):
		return x * y
	return reduce(_multiple, List)

print('3!=',product(range(1,4,1)))
#result: 3! = 6

```
### United, they're strong

```
# input float_Str, want float.
from functools import reduce
def float_str2float(str):
	temp = str.split('.')
	def _make_num(x,y):
		return x*10 + y
	int_num = reduce(_make_num, map(int,temp[0]))
	float_num = reduce(_make_num, map(int,temp[1])) #
	for i in range(len(temp[1])):
		float_num = float_num / 10 #
	return int_num + float_num
```
# Dinner Time

![strips spaghetti](http://i.imgur.com/MEOyFxY.jpg)

Post.title: Git-101
Post._content:
***
# Enableing git
- 'cd' to target folder(in which you need to manage your modify to the files)
- Entering
```
git init
 ```
 (to enable git in this folder)

# Adding files to temporary stage
```
git add + 'file1' + ' ' + 'file2' + ' '+...+' ' + 'fileN'
```
-  if file's name has special char, you need to add double quotes

# Commiting change
```
git commit -m "you name it"
```
# Checking status
```
git status
```
# Back to privious version(everything)
```
git reflog
```
- find your commit, and copy the **first part** of string(i.e: a5f620e of "a5f620e HEAD@{0}: reset: moving to HEAD~1") aka the *commit_id*
- entering ```git reset --hard 'commit_id'
```

- you can also use 'HEAD' to represent the present version, 'HEAD~N' to represent the privious Nth version( i.e: ```git reset --hard HEAD~1```)

# Back to privious version(certain file)
There are 3 different situations in this case.
### One:Haven't added to temporary stage.
- simply using ```git checkout -- file```, bring this file to what it was when you commited it last time.

### Two:Already have added to temporary, but luckily you haven't commited it yet.
- using ```git reset HEAD file```, bring you to **situation one**.

### Three:Already commit.
- Refer "Back to privious version(everything)"
Post.raw:
---
title: Git-101
date: 2016-12-28  20:52:10
updated: 2016-12-28 20:52:10
tags: git
description: Basic using of Git
categories: git
---
***
# Enableing git
- 'cd' to target folder(in which you need to manage your modify to the files)
- Entering
```
git init
 ```
 (to enable git in this folder)

# Adding files to temporary stage
```
git add + 'file1' + ' ' + 'file2' + ' '+...+' ' + 'fileN'
```
-  if file's name has special char, you need to add double quotes

# Commiting change
```
git commit -m "you name it"
```
# Checking status
```
git status
```
# Back to privious version(everything)
```
git reflog
```
- find your commit, and copy the **first part** of string(i.e: a5f620e of "a5f620e HEAD@{0}: reset: moving to HEAD~1") aka the *commit_id*
- entering ```git reset --hard 'commit_id'
```

- you can also use 'HEAD' to represent the present version, 'HEAD~N' to represent the privious Nth version( i.e: ```git reset --hard HEAD~1```)

# Back to privious version(certain file)
There are 3 different situations in this case.
### One:Haven't added to temporary stage.
- simply using ```git checkout -- file```, bring this file to what it was when you commited it last time.

### Two:Already have added to temporary, but luckily you haven't commited it yet.
- using ```git reset HEAD file```, bring you to **situation one**.

### Three:Already commit.
- Refer "Back to privious version(everything)"

Enableing git

  • cd to target folder(in which you need to manage your modify to the files)

  • Entering

    (to enable git in this folder)

Adding files to temporary stage

  • if files name has special char, you need to add double quotes

Commiting change

Checking status

Back to privious version(everything)

  • find your commit, and copy the first part of string(i.e: a5f620e of a5f620e HEAD@{0}: reset: moving to HEAD~1) aka the commit_id

  • entering git reset --hard 'commit_id'

  • you can also use HEAD to represent the present version, HEAD~N to represent the privious Nth version( i.e: git reset --hard HEAD~1)

Back to privious version(certain file)

There are 3 different situations in this case.

One:Havent added to temporary stage.

  • simply using git checkout -- file, bring this file to what it was when you commited it last time.

Two:Already have added to temporary, but luckily you havent commited it yet.

  • using git reset HEAD file, bring you to situation one.

Three:Already commit.

  • Refer Back to privious version(everything)

Enableing git

  • cd to target folder(in which you need to manage your modify to the files)

  • Entering

    (to enable git in this folder)

Adding files to temporary stage

  • if files name has special char, you need to add double quotes

Commiting change

Checking status

Back to privious version(everything)

  • find your commit, and copy the first part of string(i.e: a5f620e of a5f620e HEAD@{0}: reset: moving to HEAD~1) aka the commit_id

  • entering git reset --hard 'commit_id'

  • you can also use HEAD to represent the present version, HEAD~N to represent the privious Nth version( i.e: git reset --hard HEAD~1)

Back to privious version(certain file)

There are 3 different situations in this case.

One:Havent added to temporary stage.

  • simply using git checkout -- file, bring this file to what it was when you commited it last time.

Two:Already have added to temporary, but luckily you havent commited it yet.

  • using git reset HEAD file, bring you to situation one.

Three:Already commit.

  • Refer Back to privious version(everything)

Post.title: Git_branch
Post._content:
- 1.To list branch(s)

```
>>> git branch

* master
another branch
another different branch
...
# Star means current branch
```

- 2.To create a branch and switch to it

```
>>> git checkout -b name

M	AutoFlux.scpt
M	myblog
M	python/.DS_Store
M	python/cipher.py
M	python/playground/.DS_Store
...
Switched to a new branch 'name'
```

- 3.Doing your work and then commit it as usual

- 4.Merge to the master branch

```
>>> git merge name

 Updating be090ce..78a04d9
 Fast-forward
 AutoFlux.scpt                   | Bin 1602 -> 1598 bytes
 README.md                       |   2 ++
 python/.DS_Store                | Bin 10244 -> 14340 bytes
 python/Template/standard.py     |   9 +++++++++
 python/cipher.py                |   2 +-
 python/playground/.DS_Store     | Bin 6148 -> 6148 bytes
 python/playground/base64_try.py |  25 +++++++++++++++++++++++++
 shell/io.sh                     |   4 ++++
 8 files changed, 41 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)
 create mode 100644 python/Template/standard.py
 create mode 100644 python/playground/base64_try.py
 create mode 100644 shell/io.sh
 ...
 
```

- 5.Delete the branch

```
>>> git branch -d name

Deleted branch name (was 78a04d9).
```
Post.raw:
---
title: Git_branch
date: 2017-2-28  09:52:10
updated: 2017-2-28  09:52:10
tags: git
description: Creating branch is quick
categories: git
---


- 1.To list branch(s)

```
>>> git branch

* master
another branch
another different branch
...
# Star means current branch
```

- 2.To create a branch and switch to it

```
>>> git checkout -b name

M	AutoFlux.scpt
M	myblog
M	python/.DS_Store
M	python/cipher.py
M	python/playground/.DS_Store
...
Switched to a new branch 'name'
```

- 3.Doing your work and then commit it as usual

- 4.Merge to the master branch

```
>>> git merge name

 Updating be090ce..78a04d9
 Fast-forward
 AutoFlux.scpt                   | Bin 1602 -> 1598 bytes
 README.md                       |   2 ++
 python/.DS_Store                | Bin 10244 -> 14340 bytes
 python/Template/standard.py     |   9 +++++++++
 python/cipher.py                |   2 +-
 python/playground/.DS_Store     | Bin 6148 -> 6148 bytes
 python/playground/base64_try.py |  25 +++++++++++++++++++++++++
 shell/io.sh                     |   4 ++++
 8 files changed, 41 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)
 create mode 100644 python/Template/standard.py
 create mode 100644 python/playground/base64_try.py
 create mode 100644 shell/io.sh
 ...
 
```

- 5.Delete the branch

```
>>> git branch -d name

Deleted branch name (was 78a04d9).
```
Post.content:
• 1.To list branch(s)
  • 2.To create a branch and switch to it

  • 3.Doing your work and then commit it as usual

  • 4.Merge to the master branch

  • 5.Delete the branch

  • 2.To create a branch and switch to it

  • 3.Doing your work and then commit it as usual

  • 4.Merge to the master branch

  • 5.Delete the branch

Post.title: openwrt ipv6DHCP
Post._content:
# 
- openwrtopkg
- V6natnat && trace
		opkg update
		opkg install kmod-ipt-nat6
		opkg install iputils-tracepath6
- vi /etc/config/dhcplan'
		config dhcp 'lan'
    		option interface 'lan'
    		option start '100'
    		option limit '150'
    		option leasetime '12h'
    		option dhcpv6 'server'
    		option ra 'server'
    		option ra_management '1'     #
    		option ra_default '1'        #
- vi /etc/firewall.user,, IPv6 IP
		ip6tables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o $(uci -q get network.wan6.ifname) -j MASQUERADE
        // ip6tables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o eth0.2 -j MASQUERADE
- vi /etc/hotplug.d/iface/90-ipv6 ~~chmod +755~~//root
		#!/bin/sh 
		[ "$ACTION" = ifup ] || exit 0
		[ "$INTERFACE" = wan6 ] && {              
  		route -A inet6 add ::/0 gw $(tracepath6 -n tv.byr.cn | grep ' 1: ' | awk 'NR==1 {print $2}') dev $(uci -q get network.wan6.ifname)
		}
        //[ "$ACTION" = ifup ] || exit 0
		//route -A inet6 add default gw 2001:1234:1234:1234::1tracert ipv6
	***
	HC5661	OpenWrt Chaos Calmer 15.05
	- vi /etc/init.d/getIpv6 chmod 755
			#!/bin/sh /etc/rc.common     ##!/bin/sh
			#/init.d/getIpv6
			START=99
			start(){
				route -A inet6 add ::/0 gw $(tracepath6 -n ipv6.speedtest-nyc3.digitalocean.com | grep ' 1: ' | awk 'NR==1 {print $2}') dev $(uci -q get network.wan6.ifname)
				mkdir /tmp/testStart
			}
			stop(){
				mkdir /tmp/testStop
			}
	-  ln -s /etc/init.d/getIpv6 /etc/rc.d/S99getIpv6 

	***
# Reference
[openwrtIPV6 NAT && hosts](http://www.findspace.name/easycoding/1669)
[OpenWrtIPv6 NAT](http://blog.csdn.net/cod1ng/article/details/45421025)
[Openwrt](http://www.eehello.com/m/?post=107)
Post.raw:
---
title: openwrt ipv6DHCP 
date: 2016-08-4 24:00:10
updated: 2016-08-10 20:30:00
tags: router
description: 
categories: router
---
# 
- openwrtopkg
- V6natnat && trace
		opkg update
		opkg install kmod-ipt-nat6
		opkg install iputils-tracepath6
- vi /etc/config/dhcplan'
		config dhcp 'lan'
    		option interface 'lan'
    		option start '100'
    		option limit '150'
    		option leasetime '12h'
    		option dhcpv6 'server'
    		option ra 'server'
    		option ra_management '1'     #
    		option ra_default '1'        #
- vi /etc/firewall.user,, IPv6 IP
		ip6tables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o $(uci -q get network.wan6.ifname) -j MASQUERADE
        // ip6tables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o eth0.2 -j MASQUERADE
- vi /etc/hotplug.d/iface/90-ipv6 ~~chmod +755~~//root
		#!/bin/sh 
		[ "$ACTION" = ifup ] || exit 0
		[ "$INTERFACE" = wan6 ] && {              
  		route -A inet6 add ::/0 gw $(tracepath6 -n tv.byr.cn | grep ' 1: ' | awk 'NR==1 {print $2}') dev $(uci -q get network.wan6.ifname)
		}
        //[ "$ACTION" = ifup ] || exit 0
		//route -A inet6 add default gw 2001:1234:1234:1234::1tracert ipv6
	***
	HC5661	OpenWrt Chaos Calmer 15.05
	- vi /etc/init.d/getIpv6 chmod 755
			#!/bin/sh /etc/rc.common     ##!/bin/sh
			#/init.d/getIpv6
			START=99
			start(){
				route -A inet6 add ::/0 gw $(tracepath6 -n ipv6.speedtest-nyc3.digitalocean.com | grep ' 1: ' | awk 'NR==1 {print $2}') dev $(uci -q get network.wan6.ifname)
				mkdir /tmp/testStart
			}
			stop(){
				mkdir /tmp/testStop
			}
	-  ln -s /etc/init.d/getIpv6 /etc/rc.d/S99getIpv6 

	***
# Reference
[openwrtIPV6 NAT && hosts](http://www.findspace.name/easycoding/1669)
[OpenWrtIPv6 NAT](http://blog.csdn.net/cod1ng/article/details/45421025)
[Openwrt](http://www.eehello.com/m/?post=107)
Post.content:
• openwrtopkg
  • V6natnat && trace
    opkg update
opkg install kmod-ipt-nat6
opkg install iputils-tracepath6
  • vi /etc/config/dhcplan
    config dhcp 'lan'
    option interface 'lan'
    option start '100'
    option limit '150'
    option leasetime '12h'
    option dhcpv6 'server'
    option ra 'server'
    option ra_management '1'     #
    option ra_default '1'        #
  • vi /etc/firewall.user,, IPv6 IP
    ip6tables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o $(uci -q get network.wan6.ifname) -j MASQUERADE
// ip6tables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o eth0.2 -j MASQUERADE

  • vi /etc/hotplug.d/iface/90-ipv6 chmod +755//root

    #!/bin/sh 
[ "$ACTION" = ifup ] || exit 0
[ "$INTERFACE" = wan6 ] && {              
  route -A inet6 add ::/0 gw $(tracepath6 -n tv.byr.cn | grep ' 1: ' | awk 'NR==1 {print $2}') dev $(uci -q get network.wan6.ifname)
}
//[ "$ACTION" = ifup ] || exit 0
//route -A inet6 add default gw 2001:1234:1234:1234::1tracert ipv6

    HC5661 OpenWrt Chaos Calmer 15.05

    • vi /etc/init.d/getIpv6 chmod 755
      #!/bin/sh /etc/rc.common     ##!/bin/sh
#/init.d/getIpv6
START=99
start(){
    route -A inet6 add ::/0 gw $(tracepath6 -n ipv6.speedtest-nyc3.digitalocean.com | grep ' 1: ' | awk 'NR==1 {print $2}') dev $(uci -q get network.wan6.ifname)
    mkdir /tmp/testStart
}
stop(){
    mkdir /tmp/testStop
}
    • ln -s /etc/init.d/getIpv6 /etc/rc.d/S99getIpv6

    Reference

    openwrtIPV6 NAT && hosts
    OpenWrtIPv6 NAT
    Openwrt

Post.title: hexo
Post._content:
[](http://www.swiftyper.com/2016/04/17/deploy-hexo-with-git-hook/)


# VPS
- git

- 

-  SSH Key

- git /var/repo/blog.git/ 

		$ sudo mkdir /var/repo
		$ cd /var/repo
		$ sudo git init --bare blog.git    #bare

- hooks->[GitHooks](https://git-scm.com/book/zh/v2/%E8%87%AA%E5%AE%9A%E4%B9%89-Git-Git-%E9%92%A9%E5%AD%90)
Anyway,git post-receive

		$ cd /var/repo/blog.git/hooks
		$ vim post-receive    #

 
		#!/bin/sh
		git --work-tree={} --git-dir=/var/repo/blog.git checkout -f

		chmod +x post-receive

# 
-  hexo  _config.yml  [deploy] 

		deploy:
  		type: git
  		repo: @VPS:/var/repo/blog.git #SSH22
  		branch: master


- 
		hexo clean && hexo generate --deploy

		$ vim post-receive    #

#

Post.title: dns
Post._content:
# dnsmasq
- 
		yum install dnsmasq  #centos
- 
		vi /etc/dnsmasq.conf
- 
		port=5151//53GFW
		no-hosts//host
		log-queries//
		log-facility=/var/log/dnsmasq.log
-  &&  
		chkconfig dnsmasq on
		service dnsmasq status
        service dnsmasq start
- 
		netstat -tunlp|grep 5151 #
[](https://www.luoxufeiyan.com/2015/01/17/install-dnsmasq-centos/)

# 
- ~~~53( eth0 )~~~
		iptables -t nat -A OUTPUT -o eth0 -p udp --dport 53 -j DNAT --to {ip:port}
- 
		dig {}

- (Update!)([dnsmasq](https://github.com/felixonmars/dnsmasq-china-list))
		1 dnsmasq,dnsmasq
        2vi /etc/dnsmasq.conf:
                no-resolv
				no-poll    # dnsmasq  /etc/resolv.conf 
                server={ip#}      #
                strict-order
                conf-dir=/etc/dnsmasq.d   #dnsmasq
        3vi /etc/resolv.conf():
        		nameserver 127.0.0.1
		3dnsmasqVPN
        		dig {}			#
[update](https://wzyboy.im/post/874.html)

Post.title: SSH KEY
Post._content:
- [](https://help.github.com/articles/generating-a-new-ssh-key-and-adding-it-to-the-ssh-agent)

- 

		1
		2cat id_rsa.pub >> ~/.ssh/authorized_keys


- 
		1.vi /etc/ssh/sshd_config
		2.Modify those lines:
				PubkeyAuthentication          yes
				AuthorizedKeysFile           .ssh/authorized_keys
				PasswordAuthentication      no
		3.service sshd restart  #centosunix
